info.title: Credo REST API
info.description: Rest API for using Credo over HTTP

post.description: create new tenant

get.description: get tenants by query
get tenant by id

put.description:
update tenant by id.

NOTE: this does not overwrite the entire tenant record, only the properties that are passed in the body.
If you want to unset an non-required value, you can pass `null`.

get.description:
Get the verified authorization response data for a OpenID4VC verification session.

This endpoint can only be called for verification sessions where the state is `ResponseVerified`.
Find all OpenID4VC verification sessions by query
Get an OpenID4VC verification session by verification session id

put.description:
Update issuer metadata (`display` and `credentialsSupported`).

NOTE: this method overwrites the existing metadata with the new metadata, so
make sure to include all the metadata you want to keep in the new metadata.

post.description: Create an OpenID4VC issuance session by creating a credential offer

get.description: Find all OpenID4VC issuance sessions by query
Get an OpenID4VC issuance session by issuance session id

delete.description: Delete an OpenID4VC issuance session by id

get.description: Find proof exchanges by query
Retrieve the format data associated with a proof exchange
Retrieve proof exchange by proof exchange id

post.description:
Initiate a new presentation exchange as prover by sending a presentation proposal request
to the connection with the specified connection id.

Accept a presentation proposal as verifier by sending an accept proposal message
to the connection associated with the proof record.
Creates a presentation request not bound to any proposal or existing connection
Creates a presentation request bound to existing connection

Accept a presentation request as prover by sending an accept request message
to the connection associated with the proof record.

Accept a presentation as prover by sending an accept presentation message
to the connection associated with the proof record.

get.description: Retrieve all out of band records by query
Retrieve an out of band record by id

delete.description: Deletes an out of band record from the repository.

post.description:
Creates an outbound out-of-band record containing out-of-band invitation message defined in
Aries RFC 0434: Out-of-Band Protocol 1.1.

Creates an outbound out-of-band record in the same way how `createInvitation` method does it,
but it also converts out-of-band invitation message to an "legacy" invitation message defined
in RFC 0160: Connection Protocol and returns it together with out-of-band record.

Creates a new connectionless legacy invitation.

Only works with messages created from:
- /didcomm/credentials/create-offer
- /didcomm/poofs/create-request

Receive an out of band invitation. Supports urls as well as JSON messages. Also supports legacy
connection invitations

Accept a connection invitation as invitee (by sending a connection request message) for the connection with the specified connection id.
This is not needed when auto accepting of connections is enabled.

get.description: Retrieve all credential exchange records by query
Retrieve credential exchange record by credential record id

delete.description: Deletes a credential exchange record in the credential repository.

get.description: Retrieve the format data associated with a credential exchange

post.description:
Initiate a new credential exchange as holder by sending a propose credential message
to the connection with a specified connection id.

Accept a credential proposal as issuer by sending an accept proposal message
to the connection associated with the credential exchange record.

Initiate a new credential exchange as issuer by creating a credential offer
without specifying a connection id

Initiate a new credential exchange as issuer by sending a offer credential message
to the connection with the specified connection id.

Accept a credential offer as holder by sending an accept offer message
to the connection associated with the credential exchange record.

Accept a credential request as issuer by sending an accept request message
to the connection associated with the credential exchange record.

Accept a credential as holder by sending an accept credential message
to the connection associated with the credential exchange record.

get.description: Find connection record by query
Retrieve connection record by connection id

delete.description: Deletes a connection record from the connection repository.

post.description:
Accept a connection request as inviter by sending a connection response message
for the connection with the specified connection id.

This is not needed when auto accepting of connection is enabled.

Accept a connection response as invitee by sending a trust ping message
for the connection with the specified connection id.

This is not needed when auto accepting of connection is enabled.

get.description: Retrieve basic messages by connection id

post.description: Send a basic message to a connection

get.description: Resolves did and returns did resolution result

post.description:
Import a did (with optional did document).

If no did document is provided, the did will be resolved to fetch the did document.
Create a new did.

CompactJWT.description: Represents a Json Web Token in compact form.

Descriptor.description: descriptor map laying out the structure of the presentation submission.

id.description: ID to identify the descriptor from Presentation Definition Input Descriptor it coresponds to.

path.description: The path where the verifiable credential is located in the presentation submission json

format.description: The Proof or JWT algorith that the proof is in

PresentationSubmission.description: It expresses how the inputs are presented as proofs to a Verifier.

id.description: A UUID or some other unique ID to identify this Presentation Submission

definition_id.description: A UUID or some other unique ID to identify this Presentation Definition

descriptor_map.description: List of descriptors of how the claims are being mapped to presentation definition

CompactSdJwtVc.description: Represents a selective disclosure JWT vc in compact form.

state.description: The state of the verification session.

errorMessage.description: Optional error message of the error that occurred during the verification session. Will be set when state is {@link OpenId4VcVerificationSessionState.Error}

authorizationRequestJwt.description: The signed JWT containing the authorization request

authorizationRequestUri.description:
URI of the authorization request. This is the url that can be used to
retrieve the authorization request

authorizationResponsePayload.description: The payload of the received authorization response

requestSigner.description:
Signing information for the request JWT. This will be used to sign the request JWT
and to set the client_id for registration of client_metadata.

presentationExchange.description: A DIF Presentation Definition (v2) can be provided to request a Verifiable Presentation using OpenID4VP.

Record_string.unknown_.description: Construct a type with a set of properties K of type T

issuer_state.description:
OPTIONAL. String value created by the Credential Issuer and opaque to the Wallet that is used to bind the subsequent
Authorization Request with the Credential Issuer to a context set up during previous steps.

authorization_server.description: OPTIONAL string that the Wallet can use to identify the Authorization Server to use with this grant type when authorization_servers parameter in the Credential Issuer metadata has multiple entries. MUST NOT be used otherwise. The value of this parameter MUST match with one of the values in the authorization_servers array obtained from the Credential Issuer metadata

pre-authorized_code.description: REQUIRED. The code representing the Credential Issuer's authorization for the Wallet to obtain Credentials of a certain type.

user_pin_required.description:
OPTIONAL. Boolean value specifying whether the Credential Issuer expects presentation of a user PIN along with the Token Request
in a Pre-Authorized Code Flow. Default is false.

interval.description: OPTIONAL. The minimum amount of time in seconds that the Wallet SHOULD wait between polling requests to the token endpoint (in case the Authorization Server responds with error code authorization_pending - see Section 6.3). If no value is provided, Wallets MUST use 5 as the default.

authorization_server.description: OPTIONAL string that the Wallet can use to identify the Authorization Server to use with this grant type when authorization_servers parameter in the Credential Issuer metadata has multiple entries. MUST NOT be used otherwise. The value of this parameter MUST match with one of the values in the authorization_servers array obtained from the Credential Issuer metadata

credential_issuer.description: REQUIRED. The URL of the Credential Issuer, the Wallet is requested to obtain one or more Credentials from.

credentials.description:
REQUIRED. A JSON array, where every entry is a JSON object or a JSON string. If the entry is an object,
the object contains the data related to a certain credential type the Wallet MAY request.
Each object MUST contain a format Claim determining the format of the credential to be requested and
further parameters characterising the type of the credential to be requested as defined in Appendix E.
If the entry is a string, the string value MUST be one of the id values in one of the objects in the
credentials_supported Credential Issuer metadata parameter.
When processing, the Wallet MUST resolve this string value to the respective object.

grants.description:
OPTIONAL. A JSON object indicating to the Wallet the Grant Types the Credential Issuer's AS is prepared
to process for this credential offer. Every grant is represented by a key and an object.
The key value is the Grant Type identifier, the object MAY contain parameters either determining the way
the Wallet MUST use the particular grant and/or parameters the Wallet MUST send with the respective request(s).
If grants is not present or empty, the Wallet MUST determine the Grant Types the Credential Issuer's AS supports
using the respective metadata. When multiple grants are present, it's at the Wallet's discretion which one to use.

client_id.description: Some implementations might include a client_id in the offer. For instance EBSI in a same-device flow. (Cross-device tucks it in the state JWT)

state.description: The state of the issuance session.

cNonce.description: cNonce that should be used in the credential request by the holder.

cNonceExpiresAt.description: The time at which the cNonce expires.

preAuthorizedCode.description:
Pre authorized code used for the issuance session. Only used when a pre-authorized credential
offer is created.

userPin.description: Optional user pin that needs to be provided by the user in the access token request.

issuanceMetadata.description:
User-defined metadata that will be provided to the credential request to credential mapper
to allow to retrieve the needed credential input data. Can be the credential data itself,
or some other data that is needed to retrieve the credential data.

credentialOfferPayload.description: The credential offer that was used to create the issuance session.

credentialOfferUri.description:
URI of the credential offer. This is the url that cn can be used to retrieve
the credential offer

errorMessage.description: Optional error message of the error that occurred during the issuance session. Will be set when state is {@link OpenId4VcIssuanceSessionState.Error}

credentialSupportedId.description:
The id of the `credential_supported` entry that is present in the issuer
metadata. This id is used to identify the credential that is being offered.

format.description:
The format of the credential that is being offered.
MUST match the format of the `credential_supported` entry.

issuer.description:
The issuer of the credential.

Only DID based issuance is supported at the moment.

payload.description:
The payload of the credential that will be issued.

If `vct` claim is included, it MUST match the `vct` claim from the issuer metadata.
If `vct` claim is not included, it will be added automatically.

disclosureFrame.description: Disclosure frame indicating which fields of the credential can be selectively disclosed.

baseUri.description:
baseUri for the credential offer uri. By default `openid-credential-offer://` will be used
if no value is provided. If a value is provided, make sure it contains the scheme as well as `://`.

issuanceMetadata.description:
Metadata about the issuance, that will be stored in the issuance session record and
passed to the credential request to credential mapper. This can be used to e.g. store an
user identifier so user data can be fetched in the credential mapper, or the actual credential
data.

Pick_OpenId4VciCreateCredentialOfferOpti.description: From T, pick a set of properties whose keys are in the union K

baseUri.description:
baseUri for the credential offer uri. By default `openid-credential-offer://` will be used
if no value is provided. If a value is provided, make sure it contains the scheme as well as `://`.

issuanceMetadata.description:
Metadata about the issuance, that will be stored in the issuance session record and
passed to the credential request to credential mapper. This can be used to e.g. store an
user identifier so user data can be fetched in the credential mapper, or the actual credential
data.

ProofFormatDataMessagePayload_ProofForma.description:
Get the format data payload for a specific message from a list of ProofFormat interfaces and a message

For an indy offer, this resolves to the proof request format as defined here:
https://github.com/hyperledger/aries-rfcs/tree/b3a3942ef052039e73cd23d847f42947f8287da2/features/0592-indy-attachments#proof-request-format

Get the format data payload for a specific message from a list of ProofFormat interfaces and a message

For an indy offer, this resolves to the proof request format as defined here:
https://github.com/hyperledger/aries-rfcs/tree/b3a3942ef052039e73cd23d847f42947f8287da2/features/0592-indy-attachments#proof-request-format

For an indy offer, this resolves to the proof request format as defined here:
https://github.com/hyperledger/aries-rfcs/tree/b3a3942ef052039e73cd23d847f42947f8287da2/features/0592-indy-attachments#proof-request-format

AttachmentData.description: A JSON object that gives access to the actual content of the attachment

base64.description: Base64-encoded data, when representing arbitrary content inline instead of via links. Optional.

json.description: Directly embedded JSON data, when representing content inline instead of via links, and when the content is natively conveyable as JSON. Optional.

links.description: A list of zero or more locations at which the content may be fetched. Optional.

jws.description: A JSON Web Signature over the content of the attachment. Optional.

sha256.description: The hash of the content. Optional.

description.description: An optional human-readable description of the content.

filename.description: A hint about the name that might be used if this attachment is persisted as a file. It is not required, and need not be unique. If this field is present and mime-type is not, the extension on the filename may be used to infer a MIME type.

mimeType.description: Describes the MIME type of the attached content. Optional but recommended.

lastmodTime.description: A hint about when the content in this attachment was last modified.

byteCount.description: Optional, and mostly relevant when content is included by reference instead of by value. Lets the receiver guess how expensive it will be, in time, bandwidth, and storage, to fully fetch the attachment.

attributeName.description: The name that will be used to generate the linked credential

attachment.description: The attachment that needs to be linked to the credential

or CredentialsApi.negotiateProposal

DidExchangeState.description: Connection states as defined in RFC 0023.

JsonWebKey.description:
Encapsulates a JSON web key type that includes only the public properties that
can be used in DID documents.

The private properties are intentionally omitted to discourage the use
(and accidental disclosure) of private keys in DID documents.

VerificationMethod.description:
Represents the properties of a Verification Method listed in a DID document.

This data type includes public key representations that are no longer present in the spec but are still used by
several DID methods / resolvers and kept for backward compatibility.

ServiceEndpoint.description: Represents an endpoint of a Service entry in a DID document.

Service.description: Represents a Service entry in a {@link https://www.w3.org/TR/did-core/#did-document-properties DID document}.

DIDDocumentMetadata.description: Represents metadata about the DID document resulting from a {@link Resolvable.resolve} operation.

privateKeys.description: Private keys to import as part of the did document

overwrite.description: Whether to overwrite the existing did document and private keys

AnyJsonObject.description: JSON object that can contain any key-value pairs

Pick_DidCreateBaseOptions.Exclude_keyofD.description: From T, pick a set of properties whose keys are in the union K

Required_AnonCredsResolutionMetadata_.description: Make all properties in T required

Pick_ReturnType_AgentConfig-at-toJSON_.E.description: From T, pick a set of properties whose keys are in the union K

isInitialized.description: Whether the agent has been initialized.

tenant.name: x-tenant-id
tenant.description: Optional header to set the context to a specific tenant. Only needed when the --multi-tenant feature is enabled. Default value is 'default'
